title: Example WQ Assessment Workflow
text: vignette intended example water quality assessment workflow New Mexico Environment Department. Assessments occur “project” level specific NMED Surface Water Quality Bureau’s sampling schema. assessments within project conducted assessment unit (AU) basis. workflow follow four steps: Specify project-specific generic SQUID input files Prepare QA/QC data Conduct water quality analyses Make assessments Interim final products can exported RStudio point using variety functions readr::write_csv() utils::write.table().

title: Example WQ Assessment Workflow
text: need assistance discover code error, please reach Meredith Zeigler (Meredith.Zeigler@env.nm.gov) Benjamin Block (Ben.Block@tetratech.com). can also submit issue GitHub: https://github.com/NMED-Surface-Water-Quality-Bureau/NMwateR/issues.

title: Example WQ Assessment Workflow
text: Project-specific generic SQUID input files required subsequent analyses. Use head() View() dataframe explore contents. Search package example table using ??[fill_in_example_dataframe_name_here] get explanation field name. Criteria Table Required Description: Table containing water quality criteria SQUID analysis. Dig deeper: ??example_criteria_table Parameter Table Required Description: Table containing parameters SQUID analyses. Dig deeper: ??example_parameter_table RStudio Export Required Description: RStudio export SQUID contains grab water chemistry data particular project. Dig deeper: ??example_SQUID_RStudio_table Stations DU Export Required Description: Stations DU (designated use) export SQUID contains DUs AU-specific water quality criteria. Dig deeper: ??example_SQUID_DU_table Long-term Deployment Export Optional Description: Long-term deployment export SQUID. Dig deeper: ??example_SQUID_LTD_table Lake Profile Export Optional Description: Lake profile data export SQUID. Dig deeper: ??example_SQUID_LakeProfile_table LANL Stations DU Export Optional Description: Specific LANL stations . Stations DU (designated use) export SQUID contains DUs AU-specific water quality criteria. Dig deeper: ??example_LANL_DU_table LANL Water Quality Data Export Optional Description: Specific LANL stations . Contains grab water chemistry provided LANL. Dig deeper: ??example_LANL_WQ_table

what: Run the following to load example files:
title: Example WQ Assessment Workflow
code: # specify input files data(example_criteria_table) data(example_parameter_table) data(example_SQUID_RStudio_table) data(example_SQUID_DU_table) data(example_SQUID_LTD_table) data(example_SQUID_LakeProfile_table) data(example_LANL_DU_table) data(example_LANL_WQ_table)

title: Example WQ Assessment Workflow
text: Data exported SQUID immediately used analyses rather must first go QA/QC protocols formatting. NMwateR::Data_Prep() function user. Note first four arguments required, whereas LTD lake profile datasets optional. Special user instruction: Inspect initial Stations DU table. lake stations, change value(s) TEMP_WQC column 6T3 value unless segment-specific criterion.
code: # Data Prep my_data_list <- Data_Prep(criteria_table = example_criteria_table                           , parameter_table = example_parameter_table                           , SQUID_RStudio_table = example_SQUID_RStudio_table                           , SQUID_DU_table = example_SQUID_DU_table                           , SQUID_LTD_table = example_SQUID_LTD_table                           , SQUID_LakeProfile_table = example_SQUID_LakeProfile_table)  # Pull out dataframes df_Chem_combined <- my_data_list$Chem_Combined df_DU_processed <- my_data_list$DU_Processed df_Criteria <- my_data_list$Criteria_Formatted

title: Example WQ Assessment Workflow
text: following series water quality analyses can used depending type data available SQUID files used NMwateR::Data_Prep(). simple solution run water quality analyses (although see note ). Alternatively, user can determine functions run identify unique characteristics designated uses data reviewing CHARACTERISTIC_NAME , CHR_UID , DU fields. Lastly, NMwateR::Conventionals_ALU() function must run ensure assessment function (NMwateR::assessment()) works (others optional depending data availability). Note: cases, results analyses empty (.e., dataframes zero observations) due input data meeting CALM guidance requirements. dataframes included assessment step. information, see NMED Consolidated Assessment Listing Methodology (CALM) guidance manual.

title: Example WQ Assessment Workflow
text: assessment culmination water quality analyses utilizes logic SWQS CALM documents. NMwateR::assessment() function produces list four dataframes. First, indiviual results dataframe contains IR categories assigned AU/DU/parameter combination. DU results dataframe assigns IR categories AU/DU combination based individual results. AU results dataframe assigns IR categories AU based DUs assessed. Lastly, upload report NMED upload SQUID transferred ATTAINS.
code: assessment_list <- assessment(Conventionals_ALU_table = df_Conv_ALU                        , Bacteria_PCR_SCR_table = df_Bacteria_PCR_SCR                        , Conventionals_LW_table = df_Conventionals_LW                        , LTD_ALU_table = df_LTD_ALU                        , Nutrients_Lakes_table = df_Nutrients_Lakes                        , Nutrients_Streams_table = df_Nutrients_Streams                        , pH_PCR_table = df_pH_PCR                        , Salinity_IRR_table = df_Salinity_IRR                        , SS_Copper_ALU_table = df_SS_Copper_ALU                        , Toxics_ALU_nonHDM_table = df_Tox_ALU_nHDM                        , Toxics_ALU_HDM_table = df_Toxics_ALU_HDM                        , Toxics_DWS_table = df_Toxics_DWS                        , Toxics_HH_table = df_Toxics_HH                        , Toxics_IRR_table = df_Toxics_IRR                        , Toxics_LW_table = df_Toxics_LW                        , Toxics_WH_table = df_Toxics_WH                        , Turbidity_ALU_table = df_Turbidity_ALU)  df_Assess_Indiv_Res <- assessment_list$Assess_Indiv_Res # Individual results df_Assess_DU_Res <- assessment_list$Assess_DU_Res # DU results df_Assess_AU_Res <- assessment_list$Assess_AU_Res # AU results df_Assess_Upload_Report <- assessment_list$Assess_Upload_Report # SQUID upload report

what: NMED Water Quality Analysis and Assessment Functions
title: NMED Water Quality Analysis and Assessment Functions
text: NMwaterR R package water quality data management, analysis, assessment. functions support Integrated Reporting conducted New Mexico Environment Department (NMED) Surface Water Quality Bureau Program. package intended make assessment analyses faster consistent. work starts loading necessary files SQUID (NMED’s -house databse) Data_Prep(). Next comes >10 water quality analysis functions depending parameters designated uses assessed. Outputs analyses input assessment() function make initial Integrated Reporting conclusions.

title: NMED Water Quality Analysis and Assessment Functions
text: install current version use code install GitHub. use “force = TRUE” ensures package installed even already present. package remotes missing code install . vignette included package example assessment workflow using real NMED data. build vingette, build_vignettes = TRUE argument needs included. Copy paste code install package vignette. installed, vignette can accessed either running ?NMwateR RStudio console navigating via Help menu running browseVignettes("NMwateR").
code: if(!require(remotes)){install.packages("remotes")}  #install if needed install_github("NMED-Surface-Water-Quality-Bureau/NMwateR", force=TRUE) if(!require(remotes)){install.packages("remotes")}  #install if needed install_github("NMED-Surface-Water-Quality-Bureau/NMwateR", force=TRUE, build_vignettes=TRUE)

title: NMED Water Quality Analysis and Assessment Functions
text: encounter clear bug, please file issue minimal reproducible example Issues page. questions discussion, please reach Meredith Zeigler (NMED; Meredith.Zeigler@env.nm.gov) Benjamin Block (Tetra Tech; Ben.Block@tetratech.com).

what: Compile data from SQUID for water quality analyses — Data_Prep
title: Compile data from SQUID for water quality analyses — Data_Prep
text: function compiles multiple tables SQUID single output used subsequent water quality analysis functions. LTD lake profile datasets optional, whereas RStudio, stations DU, parameter, criteria tables required function run.

title: Compile data from SQUID for water quality analyses — Data_Prep
code: Data_Prep(   criteria_table,   parameter_table,   SQUID_RStudio_table,   SQUID_DU_table,   SQUID_LTD_table = NULL,   SQUID_LakeProfile_table = NULL )

title: Compile data from SQUID for water quality analyses — Data_Prep
text: criteria_table Criteria table output SQUID. Filters water quality data criteria table. criteria compare data . parameter_table Parameter table output SQUID. Filters water quality data parameter table. SQUID_RStudio_table RStudio query SQUID. Entirely grab data SQUID projects. SQUID_DU_table Stations DU table SQUID. DU AU specific water quality criteria used cases. SQUID_LTD_table Optional long-term deployment summary table SQUID. raw data. SQUID_LakeProfile_table Optional lake profile table SQUID.

title: Compile data from SQUID for water quality analyses — Data_Prep
text: dataframe containing compiled quality controlled water quality necessary subsequent analyses.

what: Assessment of water quality data using NMED SWQS and CALM logic — assessment
title: Assessment of water quality data using NMED SWQS and CALM logic — assessment
text: function uses exports various water quality analyses assesses results using logic New Mexico Surface Water Quality Standards (SWQS) NMED Consolidated Assessment Listing Methodology (CALM) guidance manual.

title: Assessment of water quality data using NMED SWQS and CALM logic — assessment
code: assessment(   Conventionals_ALU_table,   Bacteria_PCR_SCR_table = NULL,   Conventionals_LW_table = NULL,   LTD_ALU_table = NULL,   Nutrients_Lakes_table = NULL,   Nutrients_Streams_table = NULL,   pH_PCR_table = NULL,   Salinity_IRR_table = NULL,   SS_Copper_ALU_table = NULL,   Toxics_ALU_nonHDM_table = NULL,   Toxics_ALU_HDM_table = NULL,   Toxics_DWS_table = NULL,   Toxics_HH_table = NULL,   Toxics_IRR_table = NULL,   Toxics_LW_table = NULL,   Toxics_WH_table = NULL,   Turbidity_ALU_table = NULL )

title: Assessment of water quality data using NMED SWQS and CALM logic — assessment
text: Conventionals_ALU_table WQ analysis export Conventionals_ALU() function. Bacteria_PCR_SCR_table WQ analysis export Bacteria_PCR_SCR() function. Conventionals_LW_table WQ analysis export Conventionals_LW() function. LTD_ALU_table WQ analysis export LTD_ALU() function. Nutrients_Lakes_table WQ analysis export Nutrients_Lakes() function. Nutrients_Streams_table WQ analysis export Nutrients_Streams() function. pH_PCR_table WQ analysis export pH_PCR() function. Salinity_IRR_table WQ analysis export Salinity_IRR() function. SS_Copper_ALU_table WQ analysis export SS_Copper_ALU() function. Toxics_ALU_nonHDM_table WQ analysis export Toxics_ALU_nonHDM() function. Toxics_ALU_HDM_table WQ analysis export Toxics_ALU_HDM() function. Toxics_DWS_table WQ analysis export Toxics_DWS() function. Toxics_HH_table WQ analysis export Toxics_HH() function. Toxics_IRR_table WQ analysis export Toxics_IRR() function. Toxics_LW_table WQ analysis export Toxics_LW() function. Toxics_WH_table WQ analysis export Toxics_WH() function. Turbidity_ALU_table WQ analysis export Turbidity_ALU() function.

title: Assessment of water quality data using NMED SWQS and CALM logic — assessment
text: list four dataframes. Indiviual results IR categories assigned AU/DU/parameter combination. DU results IR categories assigned AU/DU combination. AU results IR categories assigned AU. Lastly, upload report NMED upload SQUID transferred ATTAINS.

title: Assessment of water quality data using NMED SWQS and CALM logic — assessment
code: if (FALSE) { # \dontrun{ assessment_list <- assessment(Conventionals_ALU_table = df_Conv_ALU , Bacteria_PCR_SCR_table = df_Bacteria_PCR_SCR , Conventionals_LW_table = df_Conventionals_LW , LTD_ALU_table = df_LTD_ALU , Nutrients_Lakes_table = df_Nutrients_Lakes , Nutrients_Streams_table = df_Nutrients_Streams , pH_PCR_table = df_pH_PCR , Salinity_IRR_table = df_Salinity_IRR , SS_Copper_ALU_table = df_SS_Copper_ALU , Toxics_ALU_nonHDM_table = df_Tox_ALU_nHDM , Toxics_ALU_HDM_table = df_Toxics_ALU_HDM , Toxics_DWS_table = df_Toxics_DWS , Toxics_HH_table = df_Toxics_HH , Toxics_IRR_table = df_Toxics_IRR , Toxics_LW_table = df_Toxics_LW , Toxics_WH_table = df_Toxics_WH , Turbidity_ALU_table = df_Turbidity_ALU) df_Assess_Indiv_Res <- assessment_list$Assess_Indiv_Res df_Assess_DU_Res <- assessment_list$Assess_DU_Res df_Assess_AU_Res <- assessment_list$Assess_AU_Res df_Assess_Upload_Report <- assessment_list$Assess_Upload_Report } # }

text: data frame 559 rows 51 columns: ASSESSMENT_UNIT_ID Assessment unit identifier ASSESSMENT_UNIT_NAME Assessment unit name AQUATIC_LIFE Aquatic life use category PROJECT_NAME Project name STATION_ID Station identifier STATION_NAME Station name SAMPLING_EVENT_TYPE Type sampling event COMMENTS General comments SE_STAFF Sampling event staff DATA_LOGGER_NAME Name data logger DATA_LOGGER_TYPE Type data logger DATA_LOGGER_NO Data logger serial number ACT_ID Activity identifier ACTII_ID Secondary activity identifier ACT_START_DATE Activity start date ACT_END_DATE Activity end date DAYS_DEPLOYED Number days deployed ACTIVITY_TYPE Type activity ACMED_NAME Measurement name ACTIVITY_COMMENTS Comments activity CHARACTERISTIC_NAME Characteristic measured MEASUREMENT Measurement value UNITS Units measurement WQS_REFERENCE Water quality standards reference > 3 days deployed Indicator deployed > 3 days ASSESSABILITY_QUALIFIER_CODE Assessability qualifier code DO_WQC Dissolved oxygen criterion Min < WQS? Flag minimum < WQS PH_LOW Lower pH threshold pH Min < pH Low? Flag pH minimum < low threshold PH_HIGH Upper pH threshold pH Max > pH High? Flag pH maximum > high threshold pH Max > 9.5? Flag pH maximum > 9.5 TEMP_WQC Temperature criterion Temp Max > Temp WQC? Flag temperature exceeds WQC SC_WQC Specific conductance criterion Max SC > SC WQC? Flag SC exceeds WQC Turbidity Max > 7? Flag turbidity exceeds 7 NTU Turbdity Thresholds Turbidity thresholds applied Turbidity Threshold Exceeded? Flag turbidity threshold exceeded NMAC_NOTES Notes NMAC review RES_COMMENTS Result comments CHR_UID Characteristic unique ID SE_TYPE_UID Sampling event type ID RES_UID Result unique ID ACT_UID Activity unique ID ACTYP_UID Activity type unique ID SE_UID Sampling event unique ID MLOC_UID Monitoring location unique ID PRJ_UID Project unique ID AU_UID Assessment unit unique ID
